data.title: Improves some text field behavior.
data.body: This patch improves text field behavior in game lobby, settings menu and asset browser.

Three things left to do:

data.title: Red Alert AI: don't build naval yards when they are impossible to deploy
data.body:
Version: Release 20150424. Steps to reproduce:

1) Start a bot-only skirmish on the map "Mass Confliction" -- one normal, turtle and rush AI. Factions and spawn positions don't matter, though the spawn points should be as far apart as possible.
2) Open the production view, wait, and observe the AIs attempt to build naval yards on this land-only map.

This is different from #4672 -- the AI should not be attempting to build naval yards when it cannot deploy them, though proposed solution 2 would solve both issues.

data.title: old westwood-maps causing lobby-crash
data.body:
some of those old westwood maps that didnt get fixed by any players ... do allow more players then actually spots are available on the map ... this is causing the lobby to crash after a couple of seconds 

the map "stalingrad" is a example http://resource.openra.net/maps/2540/... it has 5 player-slots ... but only 4 map-starting-points

data.title: Add D2k building upgrades
data.body:
This PR supersedes #7597, including an update for removed traits and a couple of fixes.
As stated on the previous PR, this fixes the tech tree + some actor namings.

Same rules apply: if you can't check the original game, consult [this for buildings](http://dune2k.com/Duniverse/Games/Dune2000/Details/HierarchyCharts) and [this for units](http://dune2k.com/View/Images/Duniverse/Games/Dune2000/HierarchyCharts/Dune2000Hierarchy.jpg).
Production tab hotkeys have been fixed.

Closes #3211.
Fixes #8010.

data.title: Actors with BuildLimit implicitly provide prerequisites
data.body:
Actors with `Buildable.BuildLimit > 0` automatically provide their name as build prerequisite in a quite hacky manner, as seen [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/0569eb640f7cd87e492d3f8dfe13cd3bc3a3dc23/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Player/TechTree.cs#L94).

Until very recently, actors with the `Building` trait did that as well, and that was considered (correctly) a hack.
Related to #5287.

My opinion is that someone should add an upgrade rule to add `ProvidesPrerequisite` to every actor that has `Buildable.BuildLimit > 0` and remove the code linked above, so prerequisite granting can finally be consistent and only explicit.

data.title: mobile gap-truck tweak

i've done some calculations , compared the "Mobile Gap Generator" with our "Gap Generator"
i see no reason for a Allies (french)  player to build a Mobile Gap Genrator (especially with the majority of games being about establishing a basewalk to win) and those stats : 

---

Mobile Gap
$ 1200
0:29
220 hp
Mobile

Gap
 $ 1100 (with powerplant)
0:28 (with powerplant)
1000 hp
None Mobile

---

Both have the same gap-range

~~imo , a candidate for a buff~~ ... especially because its supposed to be a "faction special" for france ... 
*Edit: not a buff , but a rule-tweak

data.title: Plane shadows culled from view incorrectly
data.body:
Plane shadows are culled near the top edge of view if the plane itself is culled which is obviously not correct. Tested with D2k carryalls and RA yaks on current release.

data.title: travis checks don't match that of make script
data.body:
Even though I had run make.cmd with check and all options and got no errors or warnings, travis build failed with the following output:

```
$ make all
cd thirdparty && ./fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh && cd ..

CSC OpenRA.Game.exe
CSC OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.dll

Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
make: *** [mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll] Error 1
The command "make all" exited with 2.
2.72s
$ make check
CSC OpenRA.Utility.exe
CSC mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/LoadIngamePlayerOrObserverUILogic.cs(22,8): error CS0219: Warning as Error: The variable `menuRoot' is assigned but its value is never used
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
make: *** [mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll] Error 1
The command "make check" exited with 2.
2.08s
$ make test
CSC mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/LoadIngamePlayerOrObserverUILogic.cs(22,8): error CS0219: Warning as Error: The variable `menuRoot' is assigned but its value is never used
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
make: *** [mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll] Error 1
The command "make test" exited with 2.
Done. Your build exited with 1.
```

data.title: Fixes WithIdleOverlay to start with first frame after make animation
data.body:
Fixes #8108, as noticed in #8106.

The difference is most visible if you compare bleed TS mod with this branch and build a Nod radar. Before this fix, the idle dish animation would start at the wrong frame, so there would be a noticable misalignment between the end of the make animation and "start" of the idle overlay.

This is because before this fix, the idle overlay was just not drawn, but not actually stopped/disabled, so (assuming identical Tick rate) if the make anim was 15 frames, and the idle overlay 30 frames, the overlay would "start" at frame 16 once the make anim finished.

With this fix, the idle overlay is properly stopped/disabled until the build is complete/make anim finishes, and then starts with the first frame.

Fixes starting frame for all buildings with idle overlays (mostly affects TS).

data.title: WithIdleOverlay internally ticks during make anim
data.body:
As mentioned in #8106, it doesn't draw during make animation but internally ticks away anyway, as a result when the make anim finishes and the idle overlay becomes visible, it doesn't start with the first frame.

A simple fix is to add a `!buildComplete` to the 'disabled' check.

I'll file a PR shortly.

data.title: Several TD mod fixes
data.body:
Fixes #8040

Result of my work on TDX.

I have more in the pipeline, but that may take a while. Those were the easiest to port.

Maps:
- Dramatically reduced tile errors on Rogue States and Necessary Illusions, additionally fixed tiberium tree placement
- Replaced tc\* temperate tree groups with desert tree t18 on Rogue States and Chokepoint
- Fixed tiberium tree positions on Break of Day, as well as a minor tile error

Art:
- Converted rank and levelup shps to TD palette
- split Nod airfield's radar dish into separate idle overlay, it looked weird if it's only played when a unit is delivered.

Sound:
- Added two previously unused voice reports to Commando voice set.

data.title: Removes LeaveMap window.
data.body: So that it is possible to look at the map after game has ended. The map is frozen, it is possible to select units but not order them. I added buttons to ra, td and d2k mods.

data.title: Add D2k faction description tooltips
data.body:
Fixes the D2k part of #6288 using 4f4c67735d45bf20f62b9b334e19a6294a9e4b7b as template.
Depends on #8099. When that is merged the (sloppy) first commit will be gone.

data.title: Fix graphical glitches & crashes related to map loading
data.body:
Fixes #7877 
Fixes #8049

Always access the SheetBuilder from the main thread in MapCache.

Not doing this can occasionally this can result in a cross thread call to the backing texture which leads to bad things. This stops trying to be clever regarding the thread safety invariants exposed by SheetBuilder and does things simply and safely: All updates happen on the main thread.

data.title: Fix objectives window
data.body:
Fixes #8100.

The container widget previously had no size, which meant it was being excluded from drawing by the logic introduced into the scroll panel in #7917. Providing a sensibly defined size avoids the problem.

data.title: Cleanup unused DLL references
data.body:
With the effort of moving shared code to `Mods.Common` apparently done, there are now **no** (at least explicit) class dependencies between any of the mod DLLs.
So here is a little unused references cleanup.

data.title: Objectives window in single player missions is empty
data.body: Mission objectives are not shown. This is caused by #7917.

data.title: Only issue a MouseMove event if the scroll offset actually changed.
data.body: Fixes #8098.  Easiest testcase is the lobby.

data.title: Tooltips don't work if there is a visible scrollpanel
data.body: This affects the lobby (faction and spawn tooltips) and #8065.

data.title: Fixes location of phase transport being revealed by attack line.
data.body:
Location of cloaked enemy phase transport is revealed by attack line if the player has satellite. Units don't attack it but choose it as a target. This patch fixes it by reordering IsTargetable() checks.

![cloaked_unit_auto_targeted](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/7497245/f5b185ea-f421-11e4-9eb5-566bccc51349.png)

data.title: Destroyed buildings should vanish if you have GPS
data.body:
Currently if you destroy a fog of war covered building, it still looks like it's there even though your GPS should be telling you it isn't.

Also, if you attack a fog of war covered building (with or without GPS) that you have already destroyed, it becomes a move order.  This doesn't really make sense - if your units know the building isn't there, it shouldn't still appear.  Either they should fire at the ground or the building should disappear.

data.title: Add one more D2k tile definition
data.body:
The tile is found on the map shown in #8089.
The one marked here:

![](http://i.imgur.com/X6eEVeT.png)

data.title: Make HackyAI squad creation a little more flexible and controllable
data.body: This might even be enough to make it somewhat usable for singleplayer missions, as this should allow to artificially limit the attack frequency and squad size.

data.title: Why not Generals instead of countries for RA?
data.body: Then we can have more options for making stuff?

data.title: Portable download?
data.body:
I downloaded the .zip file because I needed a copy without an installer (something I can copy/paste onto multiple computers). The .zip file turned out to be a mac version.  Pretty please provide a .zip file without an installer? This should simply be the files output by the installer, without the installer.

At the very least, it would be appreciated if you marked the .zip as being for macs on the release page. .dmg would be obvious, and tgz is usually source code, but .zip is multiplatform and multiuse, and so not clear from the name (except the release part).

data.title: Don't do trait lookups for Health on each processed order
data.body: A small random fix that will save _a ton_ of unnecessary trait lookups.

data.title: Make some traits upgradable
data.body: This is probably the last step toward using `DeployToUpgrade` for implementing Thumper infantry for D2k and one of the last for GIs (as I understand they still need `Armor` to be upgradable, toward what I'm working with my other set of PRs, currently #8066).

data.title: D2k map importer (or tileset) regression
data.body:
Three months ago, the D2k map importer was merged.
Shortly before it was, I took the screenshot found [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5875#issuecomment-67397799), ingame from a map I had imported with it. Notice how there are no obvious visual problems.
![](http://i.imgur.com/BPfq1xA.png)

Today I tried to import the same map using the latest bleed (commit a310411bcc70dce87d63d115862583a7b2af6265).
The result was:
![](http://i.imgur.com/yXShwGU.png)

I then checked out the branch that the map importer was merged from (commit 922af4d9cf0b99942f6b0823b16691782e8ddb33, 3 months ago) and reimported the map. The result was this:
![](http://i.imgur.com/pGLEACb.png)

**And finally, this is how the map _should_ look:**

![](http://i20.photobucket.com/albums/b215/pa-pa-pa/mapYYYY-12-DD_06-30-35.png)

Obviously even the originally imported map was not perfect, but it was much, much better than what bleed imported today.

**EDIT:** The map importer was merged on 18.02. The 28.03 playtest produces the same results as current bleed, which means the situation regressed during the first 5 weeks after it was merged. This seriously cuts down on commits that need to be checked.
